text: Why am I still here This past year has been a fucking roller coaster on the emotions  Four different times I ve came very close to acting on my plans to end my life  The only thing that s stopping me is my dog  Out of all the things  I never would have thought he d be the only thing keeping me alive  I adopted him from the pound and over the time I ve had him  he s became very attached to me  When I moved away to college this last semester  my parents would report back he d search for me and mope around when he couldn t find me  I don t know if it s the overwhelming guilt that my dog would be shattered or not   This time though  I m actually a little scared  I flunked this semester  lost two scholarships which made college possible  and my parents are kicking me out  I m afraid this might be the true end  I won t be able to take care of my dog  I ll end up inevitability failing him like I have everyone else in my life   With the situation hitting like it is  I m having the hardest time sleeping as more thoughts of ending my life slip into my mind  Maybe I should just do the deed  and make the world a better place Anyways  sorry for wasting your time today

text: You have not  and will not ever see a perfect circle  Let me explain The closest thing you have probably seen to a perfect circle  is a picture on a screen  Those have tiny pixels  which make it so it isn t a perfect circle In real life  nobody can draw a perfect circle  Even with a tool like a compass  it shifts a tiny bit  It won t be a lot that you can notice  but it does shift   Objects can t be perfect circles either  It was made by either a machine or a person  As I just said  people can t make perfect circles  Machines on the other hand  still can t  They have been programmed to move  This means that it won t ever be perfect  because it will move up  down  left  and right  It cannot be perfect   Thank you for coming to my Ted Talk
summary: Nobody can draw a perfect circle in real life. Objects can't be perfect either. Machines have been programmed to move so they can't ever be perfect too.  Ted Talk was given by Ted Talker, John. John.
cleaned: draw perfect circle real life object not perfect machine program not perfect ted talk give ted talker john john

text: Living life high as a kiteFunny enough  the day I opened the gates of hell and set free all of the demons inside me  was the day that I became obsessed with balloons   Believe it or not  I could manage to combine something that is supposed to bring you joy with all of my problems   Just imagine how life would be if everyone carried a balloon with them  Just imagine the streets full of bright and colorful floating balls  Scary huh   But what if I told you that every balloon represents the personality of the person who carries it  That s exactly where I wanted to get  I must tell you  my balloon isn t pretty at all  it has scars  band aids and that sad and miserable face  It s like when people say you have a cloud on top of you when you re feeling down but instead  you have a personality balloon with feelings   When I was a kid I used to flight kites just for fun and some kids would use a product made with glass on the nylon just so they would cut the cord of your kite in the air and you d lose it  But you know   Just for fun    Let s say adult life is kind of the same  you walk around quietly  minding your own business and then comes that person with a shiny all treated and vibrant balloon just to fuck you up You just stand there with your average  trying to survive the life balloon while taking Xanax and not trying to pop yourself   I have many cuts  many stitches many scars but I still have my balloon  barely floating on top of me as if it wanted to be popped   I write and draw when I m feeling down and in some way it helps me get it out of my system  My depression and anxiety attacks got so bad to a point in which my parents want to kick me out of the house  I just don t know how to fight back anymore
summary: The day I opened the gates of hell and set free all of the demons inside me was the day that I became obsessed with balloons. Every balloon represents the personality of the person who carries it. My depression and anxiety attacks got so bad that my parents want to kick me out of the house.
cleaned: day open gate hell set free demon inside day obsessed balloon balloon represent personality person carry depression anxiety attack get bad parent want kick house
